DataElement.preferredName: Patient Transient Ischemic Attack Cerebrovascular Accident Personal Medical History Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the participant's personal medical history of transient ischemic attack, a brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit, or cerebrovascular accident, a sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Participant Transient Ischemic Attack Cerebrovascular Accident Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the participant's personal medical history of transient ischemic attack, a brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit, or cerebrovascular accident, a sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredName: Transient Ischemic Attack Cerebrovascular Accident Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.:A sudden, nonconvulsive loss of neurologic function due to an ischemic or hemorrhagic intracranial vascular event. In general, cerebrovascular accidents are classified by anatomic location in the brain, vascular distribution, etiology, age of the affected individual, and hemorrhagic vs. nonhemorrhagic nature. (From Adams et al., Principles of Neurology, 6th ed, pp777-810):an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: A brief attack (from a few minutes to an hour) of cerebral dysfunction of vascular origin, with no persistent neurological deficit.
A sudden loss of neurological function secondary to hemorrhage or ischemia in the brain parenchyma due to a vascular event.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a prior
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a prior history of documented cerebral vascular accident or documented transient ischemic attack

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a prior history of TIA or CVA

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have you had a stroke, cerebrovascular accident, blood clot or bleeding in the brain, or transient ischemic attack

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had a TIA or CVA within the past 180 days?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of stroke, TIA or other CNS ischemic event?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a prior history of stroke or transient ischemic attack within the last 6 months?
